''Jaguar'' participated in [[Operation Abstention]] in February 1941, where she engaged the Italian destroyer ''[[Sella class destroyer|Crispi]]'' off [[Kastelorizo]] without consequences and the [[Battle of Cape Matapan]] next March. ''Jaguar'' was struck by two torpedoes fired by the [[Germany|German]] [[submarine]] [[Unterseeboot 652|''U-652'']] and sank off [[Sidi Barrani]] [[Egypt]] {{coord|31|53|N|26|18|E|display=inline}} on 26 March 1942 with the loss of 3 Officers and 190 of her crew. 8 Officers and 45 crewmen were rescued by Naval Whaler HMS Klo. ==Notes== {{reflist|2}} ==References== *{{cite web |url=http://uboat.net/allies/warships/ships/4205.html |title=HMS Jaguar (F 43) of the Royal Navy |publisher=Uboat |accessdate=26 March 2013}} * {{cite book|last=Winser|first=John de D.|title=B.E.F.
